citation.article-title: Paracoccus chinensis sp. nov., isolated from sediment of a reservoir
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paracoccus chinensis sp. nov.
Paracoccus chinensis (chi.nen′sis. N.L. masc. adj. chinensis pertaining to China, where the type strain was isolated and studied).

Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming, motile, ovoid- to coccus-shaped, 1.0×1.3–1.5–2.0 μm in size, and occur singly, in pairs, small clusters or short chains on R2A agar incubated for 3 days.
Colonies on R2A agar are circular, smooth, moist, non-glossy, low-convex and colourless to orange.
Growth occurs at 25–40 °C (optimum, 28–37 °C), pH 6.0–9.5 (optimum, pH 7.5–9.0) and with less than 1 % NaCl.
Does not grow anaerobically using nitrate as electron acceptor.
A water-insoluble yellow pigment is produced on R2A agar, with a major absorbance peak at 470 nm.
A fluorescent pigment is also produced at a low rate on King's B medium.
Positive for catalase, oxidase, urease, lecithinase and hydrolysis of casein.
Negative for arginine dihydrolase, β-galactosidase, lipase activity (Tween 80), production of indole and hydrogen sulfide, and hydrolysis of starch, gelatin and carboxymethylcellulose.
Nitrate is reduced but not nitrite.

Utilizes d-fructose, d-galactose, d-xylose, melibiose, melezitose, lactose, soluble starch, maltose, d-mannose, d-ribose, l-fucose, d-glucose, sucrose, d-sorbitol, inositol, salicin, inulin, gluconate, l-alanine, l-histidine, l-proline, l-tyrosine, l-asparagine, pyruvate, citrate and acetate, but not raffinose, d-arabinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbose, l-arabinose, malonate, mannitol, succinic acid, glycerol, lactate, succinate, l-glycine, l-cysteine, l-glutamic acid, methanol, ethanol or acetone.
Major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c/ω9t/ω12t (summed feature 7) and C18 : 0.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 69.0 mol%.
The type strain, KS-11T (=CGMCC 1.7655T=NBRC 104937T), was isolated from sediment of the Guanting reservoir in China.
